title: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
description: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
OB: When attempting to open a file with a different type of editor while the file is already open in a different editor, nothing happens and the file remains open in its original editor. Specifically, in the scenario described in 1GEWMOZ, when choosing 'Open With...' -> 'Default Text Editor' for an XML file (test.xml) that is currently open in the Scripted Resource Editor Example, no action is taken and the Scripted Resource Editor Example remains active.
EB: When an attempt is made to open a file with a different type of editor while the file is already open in a different editor, the file should be opened in the new editor, replacing the currently open editor. In the scenario described in 1GEWMOZ, choosing 'Open With...' -> 'Default Text Editor' for an XML file (test.xml) that is currently open in the Scripted Resource Editor Example should close the Scripted Resource Editor Example and open the XML file in the Default Text Editor.
SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Open a new basic project. 2. Create a new file named 'test.xml'. 3. In the Navigator, select 'test.xml' file. 4. Right-click and choose 'Open With...' -> 'Default Text Editor' from the context menu. Observe that nothing happens and the Scripted Resource Editor Example remains active.
